page.title: 18WORSBROUGH HALL
page.content: {Worsbrough Hall}is just outside the main part of Worsbrough Village in Worsbrough Park.It is separated from it by two post at the side of the road which were the park gates.The old Barnsley to Sheffield road used to pass the Hall but the owner at the time{W.B.Martin Esq}had an Act of Parliament passed to re route the road so that it did not pass his home.The Hall is of{Elizabethan style}with a centre and two wings.It used to have beautifully laid out gardens,housed a collection of rare paintings and some of the best tapestries in England.More recently it was let to a local colliery owner then bought by the National Coal board and used as offices.When they moved out in the early 1960's it was left empty and decaying.It is now being converted modern{luxury apartments}.
